text: So shall we come on him in some place where he shall be found, and we will light on him as the dew falls on the ground; and of him and of all the men who are with him we will not leave so much as one.

name: 2 Samuel 17:13
text: Moreover, if he be gone into a city, then shall all Israel bring ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until there isn"t one small stone found there."

name: 2 Samuel 17:14
text: Absalom and all the men of Israel said, "The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel." For Yahweh had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that Yahweh might bring evil on Absalom.

name: 2 Samuel 17:15
text: Then Hushai said to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, "Ahithophel counseled Absalom and the elders of Israel that way; and I have counseled this way.

name: 2 Samuel 17:16
text: Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying, "Don"t lodge this night at the fords of the wilderness, but by all means pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people who are with him.""

name: 2 Samuel 17:17
text: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz were staying by En Rogel; and a female servant used to go and tell them; and they went and told king David. For they might not be seen to come into the city.

name: 2 Samuel 17:18
text: But a boy saw them, and told Absalom. Then they both went away quickly, and came to the house of a man in Bahurim, who had a well in his court; and they went down there.

name: 2 Samuel 17:19
text: The woman took and spread the covering over the well"s mouth, and spread out bruised grain on it; and nothing was known.

name: 2 Samuel 17:20
text: Absalom"s servants came to the woman to the house; and they said, "Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?" The woman said to them, "They have gone over the brook of water." When they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Samuel 17:21
text: It happened, after they had departed, that they came up out of the well, and went and told king David; and they said to David, "Arise and pass quickly over the water; for thus has Ahithophel counseled against you."

name: 2 Samuel 17:22
text: Then David arose, and all the people who were with him, and they passed over the Jordan. By the morning light there lacked not one of them who had not gone over the Jordan.

name: 2 Samuel 17:23
text: When Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his donkey, and arose, and went home, to his city, and set his house in order, and hanged himself; and he died, and was buried in the tomb of his father.

name: 2 Samuel 17:24
text: Then David came to Mahanaim. Absalom passed over the Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.

name: 2 Samuel 17:25
text: Absalom set Amasa over the army instead of Joab. Now Amasa was the son of a man, whose name was Ithra the Israelite, who went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah, Joab"s mother.

name: 2 Samuel 17:26
text: Israel and Absalom encamped in the land of Gilead.

name: 2 Samuel 17:27
text: It happened, when David had come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lodebar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,

name: 2 Samuel 17:28
text: brought beds, basins, earthen vessels, wheat, barley, meal, parched grain, beans, lentils, roasted grain,

name: 2 Samuel 17:29
text: honey, butter, sheep, and cheese of the herd, for David, and for the people who were with him, to eat: for they said, "The people are hungry, and weary, and thirsty, in the wilderness."

name: 2 Samuel 18:1
text: David numbered the people who were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.

name: 2 Samuel 18:2
text: David sent forth the people, a third part under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab"s brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. The king said to the people, "I will surely go forth with you myself also."

name: 2 Samuel 18:3
text: But the people said, "You shall not go forth; for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us. But you are worth ten thousand of us. Therefore now it is better that you are ready to help us out of the city."

name: 2 Samuel 18:4
text: The king said to them, "I will do what seems best to you." The king stood beside the gate, and all the people went out by hundreds and by thousands.

name: 2 Samuel 18:5
text: The king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, "Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom." All the people heard when the king commanded all the captains concerning Absalom.

name: 2 Samuel 18:6
text: So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the forest of Ephraim.

name: 2 Samuel 18:7
text: The people of Israel were struck there before the servants of David, and there was a great slaughter there that day of twenty thousand men.

name: 2 Samuel 18:8
text: For the battle was there spread over the surface of all the country; and the forest devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.

name: 2 Samuel 18:9
text: Absalom happened to meet the servants of David. Absalom was riding on his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the sky and earth; and the mule that was under him went on.

name: 2 Samuel 18:10
text: A certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, "Behold, I saw Absalom hanging in an oak."

name: 2 Samuel 18:11
text: Joab said to the man who told him, "Behold, you saw it, and why didn"t you strike him there to the ground? I would have given you ten pieces of silver, and a sash."

name: 2 Samuel 18:12
text: The man said to Joab, "Though I should receive a thousand pieces of silver in my hand, I still wouldn"t put forth my hand against the king"s son; for in our hearing the king commanded you and Abishai and Ittai, saying, "Beware that none touch the young man Absalom."

name: 2 Samuel 18:13
text: Otherwise if I had dealt falsely against his life (and there is no matter hidden from the king), then you yourself would have set yourself against me."

name: 2 Samuel 18:14
text: Then Joab said, "I"m not going to wait like this with you." He took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.

name: 2 Samuel 18:15
text: Ten young men who bore Joab"s armor surrounded and struck Absalom, and killed him.

name: 2 Samuel 18:16
text: Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel; for Joab held back the people.

name: 2 Samuel 18:17
text: They took Absalom, and cast him into the great pit in the forest, and raised over him a very great heap of stones. Then all Israel fled everyone to his tent.

name: 2 Samuel 18:18
text: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself the pillar, which is in the king"s dale; for he said, "I have no son to keep my name in memory." He called the pillar after his own name; and it is called Absalom"s monument, to this day.

name: 2 Samuel 18:19
text: Then Ahimaaz the son of Zadok said, "Let me now run, and bear the king news, how that Yahweh has avenged him of his enemies."

name: 2 Samuel 18:20
text: Joab said to him, "You shall not be the bearer of news this day, but you shall bear news another day. But today you shall bear no news, because the king"s son is dead."

name: 2 Samuel 18:21
text: Then Joab said to the Cushite, "Go, tell the king what you have seen!" The Cushite bowed himself to Joab, and ran.

name: 2 Samuel 18:22
text: Then Ahimaaz the son of Zadok said yet again to Joab, "But come what may, please let me also run after the Cushite." Joab said, "Why do you want to run, my son, since that you will have no reward for the news?"

name: 2 Samuel 18:23
text: "But come what may," he said, "I will run." He said to him, "Run!" Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the Plain, and outran the Cushite.

name: 2 Samuel 18:24
text: Now David was sitting between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof of the gate to the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, a man running alone.

name: 2 Samuel 18:25
text: The watchman cried, and told the king. The king said, "If he is alone, there is news in his mouth." He came closer and closer.

name: 2 Samuel 18:26
text: The watchman saw another man running; and the watchman called to the porter, and said, "Behold, a man running alone!" The king said, "He also brings news."

name: 2 Samuel 18:27
text: The watchman said, "I think the running of the first one is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok." The king said, "He is a good man, and comes with good news."

name: 2 Samuel 18:28
text: Ahimaaz called, and said to the king, "All is well." He bowed himself before the king with his face to the earth, and said, "Blessed is Yahweh your God, who has delivered up the men who lifted up their hand against my lord the king!"

name: 2 Samuel 18:29
text: The king said, "Is it well with the young man Absalom?" Ahimaaz answered, "When Joab sent the king"s servant, even me your servant, I saw a great tumult, but I don"t know what it was."

name: 2 Samuel 18:30
text: The king said, "Turn aside, and stand here." He turned aside, and stood still.

name: 2 Samuel 18:31
text: Behold, the Cushite came. The Cushite said, "News for my lord the king; for Yahweh has avenged you this day of all those who rose up against you."

name: 2 Samuel 18:32
text: The king said to the Cushite, "Is it well with the young man Absalom?" The Cushite answered, "May the enemies of my lord the king, and all who rise up against you to do you harm, be as that young man is."

name: 2 Samuel 18:33
text: The king was much moved, and went up to the room over the gate, and wept. As he went, he said, "My son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! I wish I had died for you, Absalom, my son, my son!"

name: 2 Samuel 19:1
text: It was told Joab, "Behold, the king weeps and mourns for Absalom."

name: 2 Samuel 19:2
text: The victory that day was turned into mourning to all the people; for the people heard it said that day, "The king grieves for his son."

name: 2 Samuel 19:3
text: The people sneaked into the city that day, as people who are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.

name: 2 Samuel 19:4
text: The king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice, "My son Absalom, Absalom, my son, my son!"

name: 2 Samuel 19:5
text: Joab came into the house to the king, and said, "You have shamed this day the faces of all your servants, who this day have saved your life, and the lives of your sons and of your daughters, and the lives of your wives, and the lives of your concubines;

name: 2 Samuel 19:6
text: in that you love those who hate you, and hate those who love you. For you have declared this day, that princes and servants are nothing to you. For today I perceive that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it would have pleased you well.

name: 2 Samuel 19:7
text: Now therefore arise, go out, and speak to comfort your servants; for I swear by Yahweh, if you don"t go out, not a man will stay with you this night. That would be worse to you than all the evil that has happened to you from your youth until now."

name: 2 Samuel 19:8
text: Then the king arose, and sat in the gate. They told to all the people, saying, "Behold, the king is sitting in the gate." All the people came before the king. Now Israel had fled every man to his tent.

name: 2 Samuel 19:9
text: All the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, "The king delivered us out of the hand of our enemies, and he saved us out of the hand of the Philistines; and now he has fled out of the land from Absalom.

name: 2 Samuel 19:10
text: Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle. Now therefore why don"t you speak a word of bringing the king back?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:11
text: King David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, saying, "Speak to the elders of Judah, saying, "Why are you the last to bring the king back to his house? Since the speech of all Israel has come to the king, to return him to his house.

name: 2 Samuel 19:12
text: You are my brothers, you are my bone and my flesh. Why then are you the last to bring back the king?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:13
text: Say to Amasa, "Aren"t you my bone and my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if you aren"t captain of the army before me continually in the room of Joab.""

name: 2 Samuel 19:14
text: He bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as one man; so that they sent to the king, saying, "Return, you and all your servants."

name: 2 Samuel 19:15
text: So the king returned, and came to the Jordan. Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to bring the king over the Jordan.

name: 2 Samuel 19:16
text: Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, who was of Bahurim, hurried and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David.

name: 2 Samuel 19:17
text: There were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him; and they went through the Jordan in the presence of the king.

name: 2 Samuel 19:18
text: A ferry boat went to bring over the king"s household, and to do what he thought good. Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, when he had come over the Jordan.

name: 2 Samuel 19:19
text: He said to the king, "Don"t let my lord impute iniquity to me, nor remember that which your servant did perversely the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.

name: 2 Samuel 19:20
text: For your servant knows that I have sinned. Therefore, behold, I have come this day the first of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king."

name: 2 Samuel 19:21
text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered, "Shall Shimei not be put to death for this, because he cursed Yahweh"s anointed?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:22
text: David said, "What have I to do with you, you sons of Zeruiah, that you should this day be adversaries to me? Shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel? For don"t I know that I am this day king over Israel?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:23
text: The king said to Shimei, "You shall not die." The king swore to him.

name: 2 Samuel 19:24
text: Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king; and he had neither groomed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came home in peace.

name: 2 Samuel 19:25
text: It happened, when he had come to Jerusalem to meet the king, that the king said to him, "Why didn"t you go with me, Mephibosheth?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:26
text: He answered, "My lord, O king, my servant deceived me. For your servant said, I will saddle me a donkey, that I may ride thereon, and go with the king; because your servant is lame.

name: 2 Samuel 19:27
text: He has slandered your servant to my lord the king; but my lord the king is as an angel of God. Do therefore what is good in your eyes.

name: 2 Samuel 19:28
text: For all my father"s house were but dead men before my lord the king; yet you set your servant among those who ate at your own table. What right therefore have I yet that I should cry any more to the king?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:29
text: The king said to him, "Why do you speak any more of your matters? I say, you and Ziba divide the land."

name: 2 Samuel 19:30
text: Mephibosheth said to the king, "Yes, let him take all, because my lord the king has come in peace to his own house."

name: 2 Samuel 19:31
text: Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim; and he went over the Jordan with the king, to conduct him over the Jordan.

name: 2 Samuel 19:32
text: Now Barzillai was a very aged man, even eighty years old: and he had provided the king with sustenance while he lay at Mahanaim; for he was a very great man.

name: 2 Samuel 19:33
text: The king said to Barzillai, "Come over with me, and I will sustain you with me in Jerusalem."

name: 2 Samuel 19:34
text: Barzillai said to the king, "How many are the days of the years of my life, that I should go up with the king to Jerusalem?

name: 2 Samuel 19:35
text: I am this day eighty years old. Can I discern between good and bad? Can your servant taste what I eat or what I drink? Can I hear any more the voice of singing men and singing women? Why then should your servant be yet a burden to my lord the king?

name: 2 Samuel 19:36
text: Your servant would but just go over the Jordan with the king. Why should the king repay me with such a reward?

name: 2 Samuel 19:37
text: Please let your servant turn back again, that I may die in my own city, by the grave of my father and my mother. But behold, your servant Chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what shall seem good to you."

name: 2 Samuel 19:38
text: The king answered, "Chimham shall go over with me, and I will do to him that which shall seem good to you. Whatever you require of me, that I will do for you."

name: 2 Samuel 19:39
text: All the people went over the Jordan, and the king went over. Then the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned to his own place.

name: 2 Samuel 19:40
text: So the king went over to Gilgal, and Chimham went over with him. All the people of Judah brought the king over, and also half the people of Israel.

name: 2 Samuel 19:41
text: Behold, all the men of Israel came to the king, and said to the king, "Why have our brothers the men of Judah stolen you away, and brought the king, and his household, over the Jordan, and all David"s men with him?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:42
text: All the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, "Because the king is a close relative to us. Why then are you angry about this matter? Have we eaten at all at the king"s cost? Or has he given us any gift?"

name: 2 Samuel 19:43
text: The men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, "We have ten parts in the king, and we have also more claim to David than you. Why then did you despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our king?" The words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.

name: 2 Samuel 20:1
text: There happened to be there a base fellow, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite: and he blew the trumpet, and said, "We have no portion in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse. Every man to his tents, Israel!"

name: 2 Samuel 20:2
text: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah joined with their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Samuel 20:3
text: David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in custody, and provided them with sustenance, but didn"t go in to them. So they were shut up to the day of their death, living in widowhood.

name: 2 Samuel 20:4
text: Then the king said to Amasa, "Call me the men of Judah together within three days, and be here present."

name: 2 Samuel 20:5
text: So Amasa went to call the men of Judah together; but he stayed longer than the set time which he had appointed him.

name: 2 Samuel 20:6
text: David said to Abishai, "Now Sheba the son of Bichri will do us more harm than Absalom did. Take your lord"s servants, and pursue after him, lest he get himself fortified cities, and escape out of our sight."

name: 2 Samuel 20:7
text: There went out after him Joab"s men, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

name: 2 Samuel 20:8
text: When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came to meet them. Joab was clothed in his apparel of war that he had put on, and on it was a sash with a sword fastened on his waist in its sheath; and as he went forth it fell out.

name: 2 Samuel 20:9
text: Joab said to Amasa, "Is it well with you, my brother?" Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him.

name: 2 Samuel 20:10
text: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab"s hand. So he struck him with it in the body, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and didn"t strike him again; and he died. Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.

name: 2 Samuel 20:11
text: There stood by him one of Joab"s young men, and said, "He who favors Joab, and he who is for David, let him follow Joab!"

name: 2 Samuel 20:12
text: Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the midst of the highway. When the man saw that all the people stood still, he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over him, when he saw that everyone who came by him stood still.

name: 2 Samuel 20:13
text: When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

name: 2 Samuel 20:14
text: He went through all the tribes of Israel to Abel, and to Beth Maacah, and all the Berites: and they were gathered together, and went also after him.

name: 2 Samuel 20:15
text: They came and besieged him in Abel of Beth Maacah, and they cast up a mound against the city, and it stood against the rampart; and all the people who were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.

name: 2 Samuel 20:16
text: Then a wise woman cried out of the city, "Hear, hear! Please say to Joab, "Come near here, that I may speak with you.""

name: 2 Samuel 20:17
text: He came near to her; and the woman said, "Are you Joab?" He answered, "I am." Then she said to him, "Hear the words of your handmaid." He answered, "I do hear."

name: 2 Samuel 20:18
text: Then she spoke, saying, "They were used to say in old times, "They shall surely ask counsel at Abel;" and so they settled it.

name: 2 Samuel 20:19
text: I am among those who are peaceable and faithful in Israel. You seek to destroy a city and a mother in Israel. Why will you swallow up the inheritance of Yahweh?"

name: 2 Samuel 20:20
text: Joab answered, "Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.

name: 2 Samuel 20:21
text: The matter is not so. But a man of the hill country of Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, has lifted up his hand against the king, even against David. Deliver him only, and I will depart from the city." The woman said to Joab, "Behold, his head shall be thrown to you over the wall."

name: 2 Samuel 20:22
text: Then the woman went to all the people in her wisdom. They cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. He blew the trumpet, and they were dispersed from the city, every man to his tent. Joab returned to Jerusalem to the king.

name: 2 Samuel 20:23
text: Now Joab was over all the army of Israel; and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites;

name: 2 Samuel 20:24
text: and Adoram was over the men subject to forced labor; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the recorder;

name: 2 Samuel 20:25
text: and Sheva was scribe; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

name: 2 Samuel 20:26
text: and also Ira the Jairite was chief minister to David.

name: 2 Samuel 21:1
text: There was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David sought the face of Yahweh. Yahweh said, "It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he put to death the Gibeonites."

name: 2 Samuel 21:2
text: The king called the Gibeonites, and said to them (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn to them: and Saul sought to kill them in his zeal for the children of Israel and Judah);

name: 2 Samuel 21:3
text: and David said to the Gibeonites, "What shall I do for you? And with what shall I make atonement, that you may bless the inheritance of Yahweh?"

name: 2 Samuel 21:4
text: The Gibeonites said to him, "It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul, or his house; neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel." He said, "Whatever you say, that will I do for you."

name: 2 Samuel 21:5
text: They said to the king, "The man who consumed us, and who devised against us, that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel,

name: 2 Samuel 21:6
text: let seven men of his sons be delivered to us, and we will hang them up to Yahweh in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of Yahweh." The king said, "I will give them."

name: 2 Samuel 21:7
text: But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of Yahweh"s oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

name: 2 Samuel 21:8
text: But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore to Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite.

name: 2 Samuel 21:9
text: He delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the mountain before Yahweh, and all seven of them fell together. They were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest.

name: 2 Samuel 21:10
text: Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her on the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured on them from the sky. She allowed neither the birds of the sky to rest on them by day, nor the animals of the field by night.

name: 2 Samuel 21:11
text: It was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

name: 2 Samuel 21:12
text: David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh Gilead, who had stolen them from the street of Beth Shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, in the day that the Philistines killed Saul in Gilboa;

name: 2 Samuel 21:13
text: and he brought up from there the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son: and they gathered the bones of those who were hanged.

name: 2 Samuel 21:14
text: They buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the tomb of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. After that God was entreated for the land.

name: 2 Samuel 21:15
text: The Philistines had war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines. David grew faint;

name: 2 Samuel 21:16
text: and Ishbibenob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being armed with a new sword, thought to have slain David.

name: 2 Samuel 21:17
text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah helped him, and struck the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David swore to him, saying, "You shall go no more out with us to battle, that you don"t quench the lamp of Israel."

name: 2 Samuel 21:18
text: It came to pass after this, that there was again war with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, who was of the sons of the giant.

name: 2 Samuel 21:19
text: There was again war with the Philistines at Gob; and Elhanan the son of Jaareoregim the Bethlehemite killed Goliath the Gittite"s brother, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver"s beam.

name: 2 Samuel 21:20
text: There was again war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant.

name: 2 Samuel 21:21
text: When he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimei, David"s brother, killed him.

name: 2 Samuel 21:22
text: These four were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.

name: 2 Samuel 22:1
text: David spoke to Yahweh the words of this song in the day that Yahweh delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul:

name: 2 Samuel 22:2
text: and he said, "Yahweh is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer, even mine;

name: 2 Samuel 22:3
text: God, my rock, in him I will take refuge; my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge. My savior, you save me from violence.

name: 2 Samuel 22:4
text: I will call on Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised: So shall I be saved from my enemies.

name: 2 Samuel 22:5
text: For the waves of death surrounded me. The floods of ungodliness made me afraid.

name: 2 Samuel 22:6
text: The cords of Sheol were around me. The snares of death caught me.

name: 2 Samuel 22:7
text: In my distress I called on Yahweh. Yes, I called to my God. He heard my voice out of his temple. My cry came into his ears.

name: 2 Samuel 22:8
text: Then the earth shook and trembled. The foundations of heaven quaked and were shaken, because he was angry.

name: 2 Samuel 22:9
text: Smoke went up out of his nostrils. Fire out of his mouth devoured. Coals were kindled by it.

name: 2 Samuel 22:10
text: He bowed the heavens also, and came down. Thick darkness was under his feet.

name: 2 Samuel 22:11
text: He rode on a cherub, and flew. Yes, he was seen on the wings of the wind.

name: 2 Samuel 22:12
text: He made darkness pavilions around himself: gathering of waters, and thick clouds of the skies.

name: 2 Samuel 22:13
text: At the brightness before him, coals of fire were kindled.

name: 2 Samuel 22:14
text: Yahweh thundered from heaven. The Most High uttered his voice.

name: 2 Samuel 22:15
text: He sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and confused them.

name: 2 Samuel 22:16
text: Then the channels of the sea appeared. The foundations of the world were laid bare by the rebuke of Yahweh, At the blast of the breath of his nostrils.

name: 2 Samuel 22:17
text: He sent from on high and he took me. He drew me out of many waters.

name: 2 Samuel 22:18
text: He delivered me from my strong enemy, from those who hated me, for they were too mighty for me.

name: 2 Samuel 22:19
text: They came on me in the day of my calamity, but Yahweh was my support.

name: 2 Samuel 22:20
text: He also brought me out into a large place. He delivered me, because he delighted in me.

name: 2 Samuel 22:21
text: Yahweh rewarded me according to my righteousness. He rewarded me according to the cleanness of my hands.

name: 2 Samuel 22:22
text: For I have kept the ways of Yahweh, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

name: 2 Samuel 22:23
text: For all his ordinances were before me. As for his statutes, I did not depart from them.

name: 2 Samuel 22:24
text: I was also perfect toward him. I kept myself from my iniquity.

name: 2 Samuel 22:25
text: Therefore Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness, According to my cleanness in his eyesight.

name: 2 Samuel 22:26
text: With the merciful you will show yourself merciful. With the perfect man you will show yourself perfect.

name: 2 Samuel 22:27
text: With the pure you will show yourself pure. With the crooked you will show yourself shrewd.

name: 2 Samuel 22:28
text: You will save the afflicted people, But your eyes are on the haughty, that you may bring them down.

name: 2 Samuel 22:29
text: For you are my lamp, Yahweh. Yahweh will light up my darkness.

name: 2 Samuel 22:30
text: For by you, I run against a troop. By my God, I leap over a wall.

name: 2 Samuel 22:31
text: As for God, his way is perfect. The word of Yahweh is tested. He is a shield to all those who take refuge in him.

name: 2 Samuel 22:32
text: For who is God, besides Yahweh? Who is a rock, besides our God?

name: 2 Samuel 22:33
text: God is my strong fortress. He makes my way perfect.

name: 2 Samuel 22:34
text: He makes his feet like hinds" feet, and sets me on my high places.

name: 2 Samuel 22:35
text: He teaches my hands to war, so that my arms bend a bow of brass.

name: 2 Samuel 22:36
text: You have also given me the shield of your salvation. Your gentleness has made me great.

name: 2 Samuel 22:37
text: You have enlarged my steps under me. My feet have not slipped.

name: 2 Samuel 22:38
text: I have pursued my enemies and destroyed them. I didn"t turn again until they were consumed.

name: 2 Samuel 22:39
text: I have consumed them, and struck them through, so that they can"t arise. Yes, they have fallen under my feet.

name: 2 Samuel 22:40
text: For you have armed me with strength for the battle. You have subdued under me those who rose up against me.

name: 2 Samuel 22:41
text: You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me, that I might cut off those who hate me.

name: 2 Samuel 22:42
text: They looked, but there was none to save; even to Yahweh, but he didn"t answer them.

name: 2 Samuel 22:43
text: Then I beat them as small as the dust of the earth. I crushed them as the mire of the streets, and spread them abroad.

name: 2 Samuel 22:44
text: You also have delivered me from the strivings of my people. You have kept me to be the head of the nations. A people whom I have not known will serve me.

name: 2 Samuel 22:45
text: The foreigners will submit themselves to me. As soon as they hear of me, they will obey me.

name: 2 Samuel 22:46
text: The foreigners will fade away, and will come trembling out of their close places.

name: 2 Samuel 22:47
text: Yahweh lives! Blessed be my rock! Exalted be God, the rock of my salvation,

name: 2 Samuel 22:48
text: even the God who executes vengeance for me, who brings down peoples under me,

name: 2 Samuel 22:49
text: who brings me away from my enemies. Yes, you lift me up above those who rise up against me. You deliver me from the violent man.

name: 2 Samuel 22:50
text: Therefore I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations. Will sing praises to your name.

name: 2 Samuel 22:51
text: He gives great deliverance to his king, and shows loving kindness to his anointed, to David and to his seed, forevermore."

name: 2 Samuel 23:1
text: Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse says, the man who was raised on high says, the anointed of the God of Jacob, the sweet psalmist of Israel:

name: 2 Samuel 23:2
text: "The Spirit of Yahweh spoke by me. His word was on my tongue.

name: 2 Samuel 23:3
text: The God of Israel said, the Rock of Israel spoke to me, "One who rules over men righteously, who rules in the fear of God,

name: 2 Samuel 23:4
text: shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun rises, a morning without clouds, when the tender grass springs out of the earth, through clear shining after rain."

name: 2 Samuel 23:5
text: Most certainly my house is not so with God, yet he has made with me an everlasting covenant, ordered in all things, and sure, for it is all my salvation, and all my desire, although he doesn"t make it grow.

name: 2 Samuel 23:6
text: But all of the ungodly shall be as thorns to be thrust away, because they can"t be taken with the hand,

name: 2 Samuel 23:7
text: But the man who touches them must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear. They shall be utterly burned with fire in their place."

name: 2 Samuel 23:8
text: These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb Basshebeth a Tahchemonite, chief of the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite, against eight hundred slain at one time.

name: 2 Samuel 23:9
text: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodai the son of an Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines who were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away.

name: 2 Samuel 23:10
text: He arose, and struck the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand froze to the sword; and Yahweh worked a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to take spoil.

name: 2 Samuel 23:11
text: After him was Shammah the son of Agee a Hararite. The Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where there was a plot of ground full of lentils; and the people fled from the Philistines.

name: 2 Samuel 23:12
text: But he stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and killed the Philistines; and Yahweh worked a great victory.

name: 2 Samuel 23:13
text: Three of the thirty chief men went down, and came to David in the harvest time to the cave of Adullam; and the troop of the Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

name: 2 Samuel 23:14
text: David was then in the stronghold; and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.

name: 2 Samuel 23:15
text: David longed, and said, "Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!"

name: 2 Samuel 23:16
text: The three mighty men broke through the army of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but he would not drink of it, but poured it out to Yahweh.

name: 2 Samuel 23:17
text: He said, "Be it far from me, Yahweh, that I should do this! Isn"t it the blood of the men who went in jeopardy of their lives?" Therefore he would not drink it. The three mighty men did these things.

name: 2 Samuel 23:18
text: Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the three. He lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them, and had a name among the three.

name: 2 Samuel 23:19
text: Wasn"t he most honorable of the three? therefore he was made their captain: however he didn"t attain to the three.

name: 2 Samuel 23:20
text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and killed a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.

name: 2 Samuel 23:21
text: He killed an Egyptian, a goodly man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian"s hand, and killed him with his own spear.

name: 2 Samuel 23:22
text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did these things, and had a name among the three mighty men.

name: 2 Samuel 23:23
text: He was more honorable than the thirty, but he didn"t attain to the three. David set him over his guard.

name: 2 Samuel 23:24
text: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,

name: 2 Samuel 23:25
text: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:26
text: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:27
text: Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:28
text: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:29
text: Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,

name: 2 Samuel 23:30
text: Benaiah a Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash.

name: 2 Samuel 23:31
text: Abialbon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:32
text: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,

name: 2 Samuel 23:33
text: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Ararite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:34
text: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maacathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:35
text: Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:36
text: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:37
text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, armor bearers to Joab the son of Zeruiah,

name: 2 Samuel 23:38
text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

name: 2 Samuel 23:39
text: Uriah the Hittite: thirty-seven in all.

name: 2 Samuel 24:1
text: Again the anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them, saying, "Go, number Israel and Judah."

name: 2 Samuel 24:2
text: The king said to Joab the captain of the army, who was with him, "Now go back and forth through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beersheba, and number the people, that I may know the sum of the people."

name: 2 Samuel 24:3
text: Joab said to the king, "Now may Yahweh your God add to the people, however many they may be, one hundred times; and may the eyes of my lord the king see it. But why does my lord the king delight in this thing?"

name: 2 Samuel 24:4
text: Notwithstanding, the king"s word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the army. Joab and the captains of the army went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.

name: 2 Samuel 24:5
text: They passed over the Jordan, and encamped in Aroer, on the right side of the city that is in the middle of the valley of Gad, and to Jazer:

name: 2 Samuel 24:6
text: then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtim Hodshi; and they came to Dan Jaan, and around to Sidon,

name: 2 Samuel 24:7
text: and came to the stronghold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites; and they went out to the south of Judah, at Beersheba.

name: 2 Samuel 24:8
text: So when they had gone back and forth through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.

name: 2 Samuel 24:9
text: Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people to the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men who drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.

name: 2 Samuel 24:10
text: David"s heart struck him after that he had numbered the people. David said to Yahweh, "I have sinned greatly in that which I have done. But now, Yahweh, put away, I beg you, the iniquity of your servant; for I have done very foolishly."

name: 2 Samuel 24:11
text: When David rose up in the morning, the word of Yahweh came to the prophet Gad, David"s seer, saying,

name: 2 Samuel 24:12
text: "Go and speak to David, "Thus says Yahweh, "I offer you three things. Choose one of them, that I may do it to you."""

name: 2 Samuel 24:13
text: So Gad came to David, and told him, and said to him, "Shall seven years of famine come to you in your land? Or will you flee three months before your foes while they pursue you? Or shall there be three days" pestilence in your land? Now answer, and consider what answer I shall return to him who sent me."

name: 2 Samuel 24:14
text: David said to Gad, "I am in distress. Let us fall now into the hand of Yahweh; for his mercies are great. Let me not fall into the hand of man."

name: 2 Samuel 24:15
text: So Yahweh sent a pestilence on Israel from the morning even to the appointed time; and there died of the people from Dan even to Beersheba seventy thousand men.

name: 2 Samuel 24:16
text: When the angel stretched out his hand toward Jerusalem to destroy it, Yahweh relented of the disaster, and said to the angel who destroyed the people, "It is enough. Now stay your hand." The angel of Yahweh was by the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.

name: 2 Samuel 24:17
text: David spoke to Yahweh when he saw the angel who struck the people, and said, "Behold, I have sinned, and I have done perversely; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand be against me, and against my father"s house."

name: 2 Samuel 24:18
text: Gad came that day to David, and said to him, "Go up, build an altar to Yahweh on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite."

name: 2 Samuel 24:19
text: David went up according to the saying of Gad, as Yahweh commanded.

name: 2 Samuel 24:20
text: Araunah looked out, and saw the king and his servants coming on toward him. Then Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.

name: 2 Samuel 24:21
text: Araunah said, "Why has my lord the king come to his servant?" David said, "To buy your threshing floor, to build an altar to Yahweh, that the plague may be stopped from afflicting the people."

name: 2 Samuel 24:22
text: Araunah said to David, "Let my lord the king take and offer up what seems good to him. Behold, the cattle for the burnt offering, and the threshing instruments and the yokes of the oxen for the wood:

name: 2 Samuel 24:23
text: all this, king, does Araunah give to the king." Araunah said to the king, "May Yahweh your God accept you."

name: 2 Samuel 24:24
text: The king said to Araunah, "No; but I will most certainly buy it from you for a price. I will not offer burnt offerings to Yahweh my God which cost me nothing." So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.

name: 2 Samuel 24:25
text: David built an altar to Yahweh there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So Yahweh was entreated for the land, and the plague was stayed from Israel.

name: 1 Kings 1:1
text: Now king David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he couldn"t keep warm.

name: 1 Kings 1:2
text: Therefore his servants said to him, "Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin. Let her stand before the king, and cherish him; and let her lie in your bosom, that my lord the king may keep warm."

name: 1 Kings 1:3
text: So they sought for a beautiful young lady throughout all the borders of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought her to the king.

name: 1 Kings 1:4
text: The young lady was very beautiful; and she cherished the king, and ministered to him; but the king didn"t know her intimately.

name: 1 Kings 1:5
text: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, "I will be king." Then he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.

name: 1 Kings 1:6
text: His father had not displeased him at any time in saying, "Why have you done so?" and he was also a very handsome man; and he was born after Absalom.

name: 1 Kings 1:7
text: He conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest: and they following Adonijah helped him.

name: 1 Kings 1:8
text: But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty men who belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.

name: 1 Kings 1:9
text: Adonijah killed sheep and cattle and fatlings by the stone of Zoheleth, which is beside En Rogel; and he called all his brothers, the king"s sons, and all the men of Judah, the king"s servants:

name: 1 Kings 1:10
text: but Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he didn"t call.

name: 1 Kings 1:11
text: Then Nathan spoke to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, "Haven"t you heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith reigns, and David our lord doesn"t know it?

name: 1 Kings 1:12
text: Now therefore come, please let me give you counsel, that you may save your own life, and the life of your son Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 1:13
text: Go in to king David, and tell him, "Didn"t you, my lord, king, swear to your handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne? Why then does Adonijah reign?"

name: 1 Kings 1:14
text: Behold, while you yet talk there with the king, I also will come in after you, and confirm your words."

name: 1 Kings 1:15
text: Bathsheba went in to the king into the room. The king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite was ministering to the king.

name: 1 Kings 1:16
text: Bathsheba bowed, and showed respect to the king. The king said, "What would you like?"

name: 1 Kings 1:17
text: She said to him, "My lord, you swore by Yahweh your God to your handmaid, "Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne."

name: 1 Kings 1:18
text: Now, behold, Adonijah reigns; and you, my lord the king, don"t know it.

name: 1 Kings 1:19
text: He has slain cattle and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and has called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the army; but he hasn"t called Solomon your servant.

name: 1 Kings 1:20
text: You, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.

name: 1 Kings 1:21
text: Otherwise it will happen, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders."

name: 1 Kings 1:22
text: Behold, while she yet talked with the king, Nathan the prophet came in.

name: 1 Kings 1:23
text: They told the king, saying, "Behold, Nathan the prophet!" When he had come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.

name: 1 Kings 1:24
text: Nathan said, "My lord, king, have you said, "Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne?"

name: 1 Kings 1:25
text: For he is gone down this day, and has slain cattle and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and has called all the king"s sons, and the captains of the army, and Abiathar the priest. Behold, they are eating and drinking before him, and say, "Long live king Adonijah!"

name: 1 Kings 1:26
text: But he hasn"t called me, even me your servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and your servant Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 1:27
text: Is this thing done by my lord the king, and you haven"t shown to your servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?"

name: 1 Kings 1:28
text: Then king David answered, "Call to me Bathsheba." She came into the king"s presence, and stood before the king.

name: 1 Kings 1:29
text: The king swore, and said, "As Yahweh lives, who has redeemed my soul out of all adversity,

name: 1 Kings 1:30
text: most certainly as I swore to you by Yahweh, the God of Israel, saying, "Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place;" most certainly so will I do this day."

name: 1 Kings 1:31
text: Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, and showed respect to the king, and said, "Let my lord king David live forever!"

name: 1 Kings 1:32
text: King David said, "Call to me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada." They came before the king.

name: 1 Kings 1:33
text: The king said to them, "Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride on my own mule, and bring him down to Gihon.

name: 1 Kings 1:34
text: Let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel. Blow the trumpet, and say, "Long live king Solomon!"

name: 1 Kings 1:35
text: Then you shall come up after him, and he shall come and sit on my throne; for he shall be king in my place. I have appointed him to be prince over Israel and over Judah."

name: 1 Kings 1:36
text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, and said, "Amen. May Yahweh, the God of my lord the king, say so.

name: 1 Kings 1:37
text: As Yahweh has been with my lord the king, even so may he be with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David."

name: 1 Kings 1:38
text: So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride on king David"s mule, and brought him to Gihon.

name: 1 Kings 1:39
text: Zadok the priest took the horn of oil out of the Tent, and anointed Solomon. They blew the trumpet; and all the people said, "Long live king Solomon!"

name: 1 Kings 1:40
text: All the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth shook with their sound.

name: 1 Kings 1:41
text: Adonijah and all the guests who were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. When Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, "Why is this noise of the city being in an uproar?"

name: 1 Kings 1:42
text: While he yet spoke, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came: and Adonijah said, "Come in; for you are a worthy man, and bring good news."

name: 1 Kings 1:43
text: Jonathan answered Adonijah, "Most certainly our lord king David has made Solomon king.

name: 1 Kings 1:44
text: The king has sent with him Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and they have caused him to ride on the king"s mule.

name: 1 Kings 1:45
text: Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon. They have come up from there rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that you have heard.

name: 1 Kings 1:46
text: Also, Solomon sits on the throne of the kingdom.

name: 1 Kings 1:47
text: Moreover the king"s servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, "May your God make the name of Solomon better than your name, and make his throne greater than your throne;" and the king bowed himself on the bed.

name: 1 Kings 1:48
text: Also thus said the king, "Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who has given one to sit on my throne this day, my eyes even seeing it.""

name: 1 Kings 1:49
text: All the guests of Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and each man went his way.

name: 1 Kings 1:50
text: Adonijah feared because of Solomon; and he arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

name: 1 Kings 1:51
text: It was told Solomon, saying, "Behold, Adonijah fears king Solomon; for, behold, he has laid hold on the horns of the altar, saying, "Let king Solomon swear to me first that he will not kill his servant with the sword.""

name: 1 Kings 1:52
text: Solomon said, "If he shows himself a worthy man, not a hair of him shall fall to the earth; but if wickedness be found in him, he shall die."

name: 1 Kings 1:53
text: So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. He came and bowed down to king Solomon; and Solomon said to him, "Go to your house."

name: 1 Kings 2:1
text: Now the days of David drew near that he should die; and he commanded Solomon his son, saying,

name: 1 Kings 2:2
text: "I am going the way of all the earth. You be strong therefore, and show yourself a man;

name: 1 Kings 2:3
text: and keep the instruction of Yahweh your God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, his commandments, his ordinances, and his testimonies, according to that which is written in the law of Moses, that you may prosper in all that you do, and wherever you turn yourself.

name: 1 Kings 2:4
text: That Yahweh may establish his word which he spoke concerning me, saying, "If your children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail you," he said, "a man on the throne of Israel."

name: 1 Kings 2:5
text: "Moreover you know also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, even what he did to the two captains of the armies of Israel, to Abner the son of Ner, and to Amasa the son of Jether, whom he killed, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war on his sash that was about his waist, and in his shoes that were on his feet.

name: 1 Kings 2:6
text: Do therefore according to your wisdom, and don"t let his gray head go down to Sheol in peace.

name: 1 Kings 2:7
text: But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those who eat at your table; for so they came to me when I fled from Absalom your brother.

name: 1 Kings 2:8
text: "Behold, there is with you Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, of Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim; but he came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I swore to him by Yahweh, saying, "I will not put you to death with the sword."

name: 1 Kings 2:9
text: Now therefore don"t hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man; and you will know what you ought to do to him, and you shall bring his gray head down to Sheol with blood."

name: 1 Kings 2:10
text: David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David.

name: 1 Kings 2:11
text: The days that David reigned over Israel were forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

name: 1 Kings 2:12
text: Solomon sat on the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was firmly established.

name: 1 Kings 2:13
text: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. She said, "Do you come peaceably?" He said, "Peaceably.

name: 1 Kings 2:14
text: He said moreover, I have something to tell you." She said, "Say on."

name: 1 Kings 2:15
text: He said, "You know that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign. However the kingdom is turned around, and has become my brother"s; for it was his from Yahweh.

name: 1 Kings 2:16
text: Now I ask one petition of you. Don"t deny me." She said to him, "Say on."

name: 1 Kings 2:17
text: He said, "Please speak to Solomon the king (for he will not tell you "no"), that he give me Abishag the Shunammite as wife."

name: 1 Kings 2:18
text: Bathsheba said, "Alright. I will speak for you to the king."

name: 1 Kings 2:19
text: Bathsheba therefore went to king Solomon, to speak to him for Adonijah. The king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself to her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a throne to be set for the king"s mother; and she sat on his right hand.

name: 1 Kings 2:20
text: Then she said, "I ask one small petition of you; don"t deny me." The king said to her, "Ask on, my mother; for I will not deny you."

name: 1 Kings 2:21
text: She said, "Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother as wife."

name: 1 Kings 2:22
text: King Solomon answered his mother, "Why do you ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Ask for him the kingdom also; for he is my elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah."

name: 1 Kings 2:23
text: Then king Solomon swore by Yahweh, saying, "God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah has not spoken this word against his own life.

name: 1 Kings 2:24
text: Now therefore as Yahweh lives, who has established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who has made me a house, as he promised, surely Adonijah shall be put to death this day."

name: 1 Kings 2:25
text: King Solomon sent by Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell on him, so that he died.

name: 1 Kings 2:26
text: To Abiathar the priest the king said, "Go to Anathoth, to your own fields; for you are worthy of death. But I will not at this time put you to death, because you bore the ark of the Lord Yahweh before David my father, and because you were afflicted in all in which my father was afflicted."

name: 1 Kings 2:27
text: So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest to Yahweh, that he might fulfill the word of Yahweh, which he spoke concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.

name: 1 Kings 2:28
text: The news came to Joab; for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he didn"t turn after Absalom. Joab fled to the Tent of Yahweh, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

name: 1 Kings 2:29
text: It was told king Solomon, "Joab has fled to the Tent of Yahweh, and behold, he is by the altar." Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, "Go, fall on him."

name: 1 Kings 2:30
text: Benaiah came to the Tent of Yahweh, and said to him, "Thus says the king, "Come forth!"" He said, "No; but I will die here." Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, "Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me."

name: 1 Kings 2:31
text: The king said to him, "Do as he has said, and fall on him, and bury him; that you may take away the blood, which Joab shed without cause, from me and from my father"s house.

name: 1 Kings 2:32
text: Yahweh will return his blood on his own head, because he fell on two men more righteous and better than he, and killed them with the sword, and my father David didn"t know it: Abner the son of Ner, captain of the army of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the army of Judah.

name: 1 Kings 2:33
text: So shall their blood return on the head of Joab, and on the head of his seed forever. But to David, and to his seed, and to his house, and to his throne, there shall be peace forever from Yahweh."

name: 1 Kings 2:34
text: Then Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up, and fell on him, and killed him; and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.

name: 1 Kings 2:35
text: The king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his place over the army; and the king put Zadok the priest in the place of Abiathar.

name: 1 Kings 2:36
text: The king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, "Build yourself a house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and don"t go out from there anywhere.

name: 1 Kings 2:37
text: For on the day you go out, and pass over the brook Kidron, know for certain that you shall surely die: your blood shall be on your own head."

name: 1 Kings 2:38
text: Shimei said to the king, "The saying is good. As my lord the king has said, so will your servant do." Shimei lived in Jerusalem many days.

name: 1 Kings 2:39
text: It happened at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. They told Shimei, saying, "Behold, your servants are in Gath."

name: 1 Kings 2:40
text: Shimei arose, and saddled his donkey, and went to Gath to Achish, to seek his servants; and Shimei went, and brought his servants from Gath.

name: 1 Kings 2:41
text: It was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and had come again.

name: 1 Kings 2:42
text: The king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, "Didn"t I adjure you by Yahweh, and warn you, saying, "Know for certain, that on the day you go out, and walk abroad any where, you shall surely die?" You said to me, "The saying that I have heard is good."

name: 1 Kings 2:43
text: Why then have you not kept the oath of Yahweh, and the commandment that I have instructed you with?"

name: 1 Kings 2:44
text: The king said moreover to Shimei, "You know all the wickedness which your heart is privy to, that you did to David my father. Therefore Yahweh shall return your wickedness on your own head.

name: 1 Kings 2:45
text: But king Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before Yahweh forever."

name: 1 Kings 2:46
text: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he went out, and fell on him, so that he died. The kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 3:1
text: Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh"s daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of Yahweh, and the wall of Jerusalem all around.

name: 1 Kings 3:2
text: Only the people sacrificed in the high places, because there was no house built for the name of Yahweh until those days.

name: 1 Kings 3:3
text: Solomon loved Yahweh, walking in the statutes of David his father: only he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

name: 1 Kings 3:4
text: The king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place. Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings on that altar.

name: 1 Kings 3:5
text: In Gibeon Yahweh appeared to Solomon in a dream by night; and God said, "Ask what I shall give you."

name: 1 Kings 3:6
text: Solomon said, "You have shown to your servant David my father great loving kindness, according as he walked before you in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with you. You have kept for him this great loving kindness, that you have given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day.

name: 1 Kings 3:7
text: Now, Yahweh my God, you have made your servant king instead of David my father. I am but a little child. I don"t know how to go out or come in.

name: 1 Kings 3:8
text: Your servant is in the midst of your people which you have chosen, a great people, that can"t be numbered nor counted for multitude.

name: 1 Kings 3:9
text: Give your servant therefore an understanding heart to judge your people, that I may discern between good and evil; for who is able to judge this your great people?"

name: 1 Kings 3:10
text: The speech pleased the Lord, that Solomon had asked this thing.

name: 1 Kings 3:11
text: God said to him, "Because you have asked this thing, and have not asked for yourself long life, neither have asked riches for yourself, nor have asked the life of your enemies, but have asked for yourself understanding to discern justice;

name: 1 Kings 3:12
text: behold, I have done according to your word. Behold, I have given you a wise and an understanding heart; so that there has been none like you before you, neither after you shall any arise like you.

name: 1 Kings 3:13
text: I have also given you that which you have not asked, both riches and honor, so that there shall not be any among the kings like you, all your days.

name: 1 Kings 3:14
text: If you will walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as your father David walked, then I will lengthen your days."

name: 1 Kings 3:15
text: Solomon awoke; and behold, it was a dream. Then he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, and offered up burnt offerings, offered peace offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.

name: 1 Kings 3:16
text: Then two women who were prostitutes came to the king, and stood before him.

name: 1 Kings 3:17
text: The one woman said, "Oh, my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house. I delivered a child with her in the house.

name: 1 Kings 3:18
text: It happened the third day after I delivered, that this woman delivered also. We were together. There was no stranger with us in the house, just us two in the house.

name: 1 Kings 3:19
text: This woman"s child died in the night, because she lay on it.

name: 1 Kings 3:20
text: She arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while your handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.

name: 1 Kings 3:21
text: When I rose in the morning to nurse my child, behold, it was dead; but when I had looked at it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, whom I bore."

name: 1 Kings 3:22
text: The other woman said, "No; but the living is my son, and the dead is your son." This said, "No; but the dead is your son, and the living is my son." Thus they spoke before the king.

name: 1 Kings 3:23
text: Then the king said, "The one says, "This is my son who lives, and your son is the dead;" and the other says, "No; but your son is the dead one, and my son is the living one.""

name: 1 Kings 3:24
text: The king said, "Get me a sword." They brought a sword before the king.

name: 1 Kings 3:25
text: The king said, "Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other."

name: 1 Kings 3:26
text: Then the woman whose the living child was spoke to the king, for her heart yearned over her son, and she said, "Oh, my lord, give her the living child, and in no way kill it!" But the other said, "It shall be neither mine nor yours. Divide it."

name: 1 Kings 3:27
text: Then the king answered, "Give her the living child, and in no way kill it. She is its mother."

name: 1 Kings 3:28
text: All Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do justice.

name: 1 Kings 4:1
text: King Solomon was king over all Israel.

name: 1 Kings 4:2
text: These were the princes whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;

name: 1 Kings 4:3
text: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder;

name: 1 Kings 4:4
text: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the army; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

name: 1 Kings 4:5
text: and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers; and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister, the king"s friend;

name: 1 Kings 4:6
text: and Ahishar was over the household; and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the men subject to forced labor.

name: 1 Kings 4:7
text: Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided food for the king and his household: each man had to make provision for a month in the year.

name: 1 Kings 4:8
text: These are their names: Ben Hur, in the hill country of Ephraim;

name: 1 Kings 4:9
text: Ben Deker, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth Shemesh, and Elon Beth Hanan;

name: 1 Kings 4:10
text: Ben Hesed, in Arubboth (to him belonged Socoh, and all the land of Hepher);

name: 1 Kings 4:11
text: Ben Abinadab, in all the height of Dor (he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon as wife);

name: 1 Kings 4:12
text: Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth Shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth Shean to Abel Meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;

name: 1 Kings 4:13
text: Ben Geber, in Ramoth Gilead (to him belonged the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; to him belonged the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, sixty great cities with walls and bronze bars);

name: 1 Kings 4:14
text: Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;

name: 1 Kings 4:15
text: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali (he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon as wife);

name: 1 Kings 4:16
text: Baana the son of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;

name: 1 Kings 4:17
text: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar;

name: 1 Kings 4:18
text: Shimei the son of Ela, in Benjamin;

name: 1 Kings 4:19
text: Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer who was in the land.

name: 1 Kings 4:20
text: Judah and Israel were many as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry.

name: 1 Kings 4:21
text: Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt: they brought tribute, and served Solomon all the days of his life.

name: 1 Kings 4:22
text: Solomon"s provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and sixty measures of meal,

name: 1 Kings 4:23
text: ten head of fat cattle, and twenty head of cattle out of the pastures, and one hundred sheep, besides harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fattened fowl.

name: 1 Kings 4:24
text: For he had dominion over all on this side the River, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, over all the kings on this side the River: and he had peace on all sides around him.

name: 1 Kings 4:25
text: Judah and Israel lived safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 4:26
text: Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.

name: 1 Kings 4:27
text: Those officers provided food for king Solomon, and for all who came to king Solomon"s table, every man in his month; they let nothing be lacking.

name: 1 Kings 4:28
text: Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds brought they to the place where the officers were, every man according to his duty.

name: 1 Kings 4:29
text: God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and very great understanding, even as the sand that is on the seashore.

name: 1 Kings 4:30
text: Solomon"s wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east, and all the wisdom of Egypt.

name: 1 Kings 4:31
text: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all the nations all around.

name: 1 Kings 4:32
text: He spoke three thousand proverbs; and his songs were one thousand five.

name: 1 Kings 4:33
text: He spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even to the hyssop that springs out of the wall; he spoke also of animals, and of birds, and of creeping things, and of fish.

name: 1 Kings 4:34
text: There came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.

name: 1 Kings 5:1
text: Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the place of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.

name: 1 Kings 5:2
text: Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,

name: 1 Kings 5:3
text: "You know how that David my father could not build a house for the name of Yahweh his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until Yahweh put them under the soles of his feet.

name: 1 Kings 5:4
text: But now Yahweh my God has given me rest on every side. There is neither adversary, nor evil occurrence.

name: 1 Kings 5:5
text: Behold, I purpose to build a house for the name of Yahweh my God, as Yahweh spoke to David my father, saying, "Your son, whom I will set on your throne in your place, he shall build the house for my name."

name: 1 Kings 5:6
text: Now therefore command that they cut me cedar trees out of Lebanon. My servants shall be with your servants; and I will give you wages for your servants according to all that you shall say. For you know that there is not among us any who knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians."

name: 1 Kings 5:7
text: It happened, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, "Blessed is Yahweh this day, who has given to David a wise son over this great people."

name: 1 Kings 5:8
text: Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, "I have heard the message which you have sent to me. I will do all your desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.

name: 1 Kings 5:9
text: My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon to the sea. I will make them into rafts to go by sea to the place that you shall appoint me, and will cause them to be broken up there, and you shall receive them. You shall accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household."

name: 1 Kings 5:10
text: So Hiram gave Solomon timber of cedar and timber of fir according to all his desire.

name: 1 Kings 5:11
text: Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil. Solomon gave this to Hiram year by year.

name: 1 Kings 5:12
text: Yahweh gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him; and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a treaty together.

name: 1 Kings 5:13
text: King Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.

name: 1 Kings 5:14
text: He sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses; a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home; and Adoniram was over the men subject to forced labor.

name: 1 Kings 5:15
text: Solomon had seventy thousand who bore burdens, and eighty thousand who were stone cutters in the mountains;

name: 1 Kings 5:16
text: besides Solomon"s chief officers who were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, who bore rule over the people who labored in the work.

name: 1 Kings 5:17
text: The king commanded, and they cut out great stones, costly stones, to lay the foundation of the house with worked stone.

name: 1 Kings 5:18
text: Solomon"s builders and Hiram"s builders and the Gebalites cut them, and prepared the timber and the stones to build the house.

name: 1 Kings 6:1
text: It happened in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon"s reign over Israel, in the month Ziv, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of Yahweh.

name: 1 Kings 6:2
text: The house which king Solomon built for Yahweh, its length was sixty cubits, and its breadth twenty, and its height thirty cubits.

name: 1 Kings 6:3
text: The porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits was its length, according to the breadth of the house. Ten cubits was its breadth before the house.

name: 1 Kings 6:4
text: For the house he made windows of fixed lattice work.

name: 1 Kings 6:5
text: Against the wall of the house he built stories all around, against the walls of the house all around, both of the temple and of the oracle; and he made side rooms all around.

name: 1 Kings 6:6
text: The nethermost story was five cubits broad, and the middle was six cubits broad, and the third was seven cubits broad; for on the outside he made offsets in the wall of the house all around, that the beams should not have hold in the walls of the house.

name: 1 Kings 6:7
text: The house, when it was in building, was built of stone prepared at the quarry; and there was neither hammer nor axe nor any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was in building.

name: 1 Kings 6:8
text: The door for the middle side rooms was in the right side of the house: and they went up by winding stairs into the middle story, and out of the middle into the third.

name: 1 Kings 6:9
text: So he built the house, and finished it; and he covered the house with beams and planks of cedar.

name: 1 Kings 6:10
text: He built the stories against all the house, each five cubits high: and they rested on the house with timber of cedar.

name: 1 Kings 6:11
text: The word of Yahweh came to Solomon, saying,

name: 1 Kings 6:12
text: "Concerning this house which you are building, if you will walk in my statutes, and execute my ordinances, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I establish my word with you, which I spoke to David your father.

name: 1 Kings 6:13
text: I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will not forsake my people Israel."

name: 1 Kings 6:14
text: So Solomon built the house, and finished it.

name: 1 Kings 6:15
text: He built the walls of the house within with boards of cedar: from the floor of the house to the walls of the ceiling, he covered them on the inside with wood; and he covered the floor of the house with boards of fir.

name: 1 Kings 6:16
text: He built twenty cubits on the hinder part of the house with boards of cedar from the floor to the ceiling: he built them for it within, for an oracle, even for the most holy place.

name: 1 Kings 6:17
text: In front of the temple sanctuary was forty cubits.

name: 1 Kings 6:18
text: There was cedar on the house within, carved with buds and open flowers: all was cedar; there was no stone seen.

name: 1 Kings 6:19
text: He prepared an oracle in the midst of the house within, to set there the ark of the covenant of Yahweh.

name: 1 Kings 6:20
text: Within the oracle was twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in its height; and he overlaid it with pure gold: and he covered the altar with cedar.

name: 1 Kings 6:21
text: So Solomon overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he drew chains of gold across before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.

name: 1 Kings 6:22
text: The whole house he overlaid with gold, until all the house was finished: also the whole altar that belonged to the oracle he overlaid with gold.

name: 1 Kings 6:23
text: In the oracle he made two cherubim of olive wood, each ten cubits high.

name: 1 Kings 6:24
text: Five cubits was the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing to the uttermost part of the other were ten cubits.

name: 1 Kings 6:25
text: The other cherub was ten cubits: both the cherubim were of one measure and one form.

name: 1 Kings 6:26
text: The height of the one cherub was ten cubits, and so was it of the other cherub.

name: 1 Kings 6:27
text: He set the cherubim within the inner house; and the wings of the cherubim were stretched forth, so that the wing of the one touched the one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; and their wings touched one another in the midst of the house.

name: 1 Kings 6:28
text: He overlaid the cherubim with gold.

name: 1 Kings 6:29
text: He carved all the walls of the house around with carved figures of cherubim and palm trees and open flowers, inside and outside.

name: 1 Kings 6:30
text: The floor of the house he overlaid with gold, inside and outside.

name: 1 Kings 6:31
text: For the entrance of the oracle he made doors of olive wood: the lintel and door posts were a fifth part of the wall.

name: 1 Kings 6:32
